overview.ovdesc:
In the Bills Module, the birth of a Bill is happens through this application. The BL.Register
is updated with details like Drawer, Drawee, Acceptor, Value of a Bill, Start date, Maturity date of the Bill, Charge code etc..
The Liability Customer if in case of a the Bill is dishonoured is determined by a default mechanism which automatically decides based on a set of rules.
The id for this application is auto generated once it is defined in AUTO.ID.START and COMPANY files. The system would allow reversal of
BILL.REGISTER not included in a
BILL.BATCH
and not included in a Bills Contract.
User could also enter dynamic particulars about the movement of a Bill like Bill Location, Status, etc. using this application.
The
BILL.TYPE entered here will distinguish the products to which the
BILL.REGISTER belongs.
Copy option is allowed in this Application.
After the no of days as mentioned in BL.PARAMETER to move it to history from the date of maturity of the BL contract, these details will be moved to history file- BL.REGISTER.HIST.

If product type is not defined in BL.TYPE, then this is a No Input field which is updated by the system once the earlier fields are populated even before the record is committed. The default in this field is directly related to the values in various other fields in the same application and the CUSTOMER Application.
The calculated value depends on the values entered in the fields Recourse, Drawer, Acceptor and Drawee.
If Recourse is Yes and Drawer is Customer, then Drawer is LIAB.CUST.
If Recourse is Yes, but Drawer is not Customer and Acceptor is Customer, then Acceptor is LIAB.CUST.
If Recourse is Yes and both Drawer and Acceptor are not Customers but Drawee is Customer, then Drawee is LIAB.CUST.
If Recourse is No and Acceptor is Customer, then Acceptor is LIAB.CUST.
If Recourse is No, but Acceptor is not Customer and Drawee is Customer, then Drawee is LIAB.CUST.
In all other cases no value would be returned for LIAB.CUST.
A Bill Register could be discounted or Collateralised only if its LIAB.CUST and Customer of the Bill Contract are same.
If Product Type is defined in BL.TYPE, LIAB.CUST will be defaulted based on the Liability party defined in BL.TYPE.

Identifies the type of charge(s) to be levied as defined on the FT.CHARGE.TYPE/ FT.COMMISSION.TYPE file.
This table contains a record for each charge type available. Each record contains a description, a default charge amount and the P&L category which is to be credited whenever the charge is levied.
The description from the FT.CHARGE.TYPE/FT.COMMISSION.TYPE will be displayed as an enrichment to this field.

Whenever a charge is processed the account entered in the associated CHARGE.ACCOUNT field will be debited. The P&L category defined on the FT.CHARGE.TYPE/FTCOMMISSION.TYPE record for the charge code will be credited.
In BL module charges will be calculated and debited to charge account during BL.BILL application processing.

This field specifies the overdue status of BL.REGISTER. If the BL.REGISTER moved to PD during maturity process, this field is updated as "PD"
No input field.
For Future use
There are three options available:
AUTOMATIC, SEMI-AUTOMATIC, MANUAL
AUTOMATIC will liquidate across the settlement accounts on the contract.
MANUAL will create a PD contract instead.
SEMI-AUTOMATIC will only raise a PD contract if insufficient funds exist on the settlement account.
For further details see the helptext in PD.PARAMETER where these settings are controlled from.
If the PD product is not defined for the current company then the only allowed setting is AUTOMATIC.

This is the date on which the Bill is due for Repayment. This should be a Date greater than Today and the Start.Date. This could be entered as a Date (Maturity Date) or as nnnnD (No.of Days) or nnM(No.of Months) or "nnn" (No of days)

If entered as nnnnD or nnM, the system would return the calculated Maturity Date by adding the No of Days or No of Months from the Start date and update the same in Maturity date as well as in fin mat date (next field). If the calculated Maturity Date is a holiday as per the currency of the contract, then the system gives override message.
If entered as "nnn", after attaching to BL system calculates the maturity date by addding "nnn" days from the BL start date and same is updated in Maturity date and fin mat date.
If the current date or a past date is keyed in, system will throw an enrichment "Cannot be Less/equal start date" and will not allow to proceed further.
Standard T24 date format
It can accept "nnn" or "nnnD" (Both No of Days from start date )or "nnM"( No of Months)

This field determines whether the discount interest received in advance is to be suspended(amortised amount is moved under a suspended category instead of PL) or recognized during amortisation.
Allowed values are YES or NO.
‘YES’ indicates that the unamortised discount interest portion is to be suspended during the next cycle of amortisation.
The discount amount is moved under IRA category(SP). When this field is set to ‘Yes’ further discounting of the BL.REGISTER is not allowed.
Dr Interest Received in advance a/c (Portion of interest)
Cr Interest Category SP (Portion of interest)
‘NO’ indicates that the suspended interest, if any, is to be recognized. The suspension is revoked and the suspended interest amount is recognized.
Further discounting on invoice is not allowed once the invoice is marked for Suspension of discount interest using this field.
